_description.iso_639_3_eng: The [International Olympic Committee](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/International_Olympic_Committee "International Olympic Committee") (IOC) uses [three-letter abbreviation](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Three-letter_abbreviation "Three-letter abbreviation") [country codes](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Country_codes "Country codes") to refer to each group of athletes that participate in the [Olympic Games](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Olympic_Games "Olympic Games"). Each [geocode](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Geocode "Geocode") usually identifies a [National Olympic Committee](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/National_Olympic_Committee "National Olympic Committee") (NOC), but there are several codes that have been used for other instances in past Games, such as teams composed of athletes from multiple nations, or groups of athletes not formally representing any nation.

_definition.iso_639_3_eng: Flag of country, using Unicode regional indicator symbol letters.
A top-level domain (TLD) is one of the domains at the highest level in the hierarchical Domain Name System of the Internet after the root domain.

Country calling codes or country dial-in codes are telephone number prefixes for reaching telephone subscribers in the networks of the member countries or regions of the International Telecommunication Union (ITU).

_description.iso_639_3_eng: This descriptor is also used as a *predicate*, in that case, the *source* node is the *language* and the *destination* node is the *country*; the predicate would mean *is official language in*.
This descriptor is also used as a *predicate*, in that case, the *source* node is the *currency* and the *destination* node is the *country*; the predicate would mean *is official currency in in*.

This descriptor is also used as a *predicate*, in that case, the *source* node is the *country of interest* and the *destination* node is the *bordering country*; the predicate would mean *shares border with*.

This field contains the [GeoJSON](https://geojson.org) geometry corresponding to the *geographic location* or *area* related to the information record which contains it. Use it to indicate the location of a tree or the area in which samples have been collected.

_definition.iso_639_3_eng: Project to which the experiment, dataset or measurement belongs.

_description.iso_639_3_eng: The field is not coded, provide the acronym of the project.

Provide a name or acronym to identify the dataset. This will be used as a group to mark all the measurements or observations that comprise a single dataset. Try not to reuse the same code for other datasets.
This field represents the `_key` of the dataset record.
This field represents the list of datasets, represented by their `_key` field, use this field to indicate to which datasets the current record belongs.
This field represents an identifier for a group of related datasets, use it to refer to datasets as a group for datasets that do not belong to a specific project.

_definition.iso_639_3_eng: List of species, genetic index and marker type combinations.

_description.iso_639_3_eng: This field holds a table that contains the list of combinations between species and genetic indexes, in which the marker type, number of loci, sequence length and technology used are provided.
This field can be used to indicate the identifier of the local dataset.
This field can be used to indicate the filename from which the dataset has been extracted.

_definition.iso_639_3_eng: Date and precise time of event, observation, measurement or sampling.

_description.iso_639_3_eng: The *timestamp* is expressed as an *integer* value representing the [standard UNIX timestamp](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Unix_time). This value is required only if the *time of day* or a *very precise moment* in time is required to be recorded.

_definition.iso_639_3_eng: Date and precise time of last update.

_description.iso_639_3_eng: The *timestamp* is expressed as an *integer* value representing the [standard UNIX timestamp](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Unix_time). This value is required only if the *time of day* or a *very precise moment* in time is required to be recorded.

_definition.iso_639_3_eng: Date and precise time of fire.

_description.iso_639_3_eng: The *timestamp* is expressed as an *integer* value representing the [standard UNIX timestamp](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Unix_time). This value is required only if the *time of day* or a *very precise moment* in time is required to be recorded.

_definition.iso_639_3_eng: Date and precise time of last fire.

_description.iso_639_3_eng: The *timestamp* is expressed as an *integer* value representing the [standard UNIX timestamp](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Unix_time). This value is required only if the *time of day* or a *very precise moment* in time is required to be recorded.

_definition.iso_639_3_eng: Date of event, observation, measurement or sampling.

_description.iso_639_3_eng: The date is expressed as an 8 character value in which the date is expressed as YYYYMMDD, 4 digit year, 2 digit month and 2 digit day. If the day is not known it can be omitted. If the month is not known both the day and month can be omitted.

This value indicates a *month*, it is an *integer* value with a range from 1, *January*, to 12, *December*. This descriptor's value does not reference a specific point in time, it will most likely be a multi-year average for the referenced month.

This property represents the *lower limit* of a *date range* of *time series data*. The value is a *numeric string* that can be expressed as a *year* (`YYYY`), *year* and *month* (`YYYYMM`) or *full date* (`YYYYMMDD`). The date range *includes this value*.

This property represents the *upper limit* of a *date range* of *time series data*. The value is a *numeric string* that can be expressed as a *year* (`YYYY`), *year* and *month* (`YYYYMM`) or *full date* (`YYYYMMDD`). The date range *includes this value*.

_definition.iso_639_3_eng: Date in which the data was submitted.

_description.iso_639_3_eng: The date is expressed as an 8 character value in which the date is expressed as YYYYMMDD, 4 digit year, 2 digit month and 2 digit day. If the day is not known it can be omitted. If the month is not known both the day and month can be omitted.

_definition.iso_639_3_eng: Time span of event, observation, measurement or sampling.

_description.iso_639_3_eng: This categorical descriptor is used to indicate a standard time interval, such as a day, month or year. It is paired with aggregated values, such as averages, to indicate the time interval of the aggregation.

_examples.iso_639_3_eng: `std_date_span_day` for *daily data*; `std_date_span_week` for *weekly data*; `std_date_span_month` for *monthly data*, `std_date_span_year` for *yearly data* and `std_date_span_range` for *time range data*.

_definition.iso_639_3_eng: List of time spans for event, observation, measurement or sampling.

_description.iso_639_3_eng: This categorical descriptor is used to indicate a set of standard time intervals, such as a day, month or year. It is used to record a set of different time ranges.

_examples.iso_639_3_eng: An array containing `std_date_span_day` for *daily data*; `std_date_span_week` for *weekly data*; `std_date_span_month` for *monthly data*, `std_date_span_year` for *yearly data* and `std_date_span_range` for *time range data*.

_description.iso_639_3_eng:
This property is an *array* containing *time series data*. Each *element* is an *object* that should contain *one property* describing the *time or date* and a [properties](properties.md) object element containing the *data* features *related* to that *date*.

The elements are assumed to be sorted by date in ascending order and no two elements should share the same date or time.
This is a collection of references to term objects, which may be terms of any kind.

_definition.iso_639_3_eng: List of descriptors whose combination represents the unique key of a record.

_description.iso_639_3_eng: When considering a list of data records there should be a combination of fields whose combined value will be unique among all elements of the dataset. This field should contain the global identifiers of these fields. Note that this does not include fields such as the reference to the dataset.

_definition.iso_639_3_eng: List of descriptors that can be used to extract data summaries.

_description.iso_639_3_eng: These descriptors represent the fields on which it should be possible to make data summaries. For instance, if you have a dataset featuring tree code, GCU, species and date, the unique identifier of a record would be tree code and date: all the fields listed before could be used to extract data summaries.

_definition.iso_639_3_eng: List of descriptors holding quantitative values.

_description.iso_639_3_eng: This is a collection of references to term objects which represent quantitative values.

_definition.iso_639_3_eng: Notes, comments and other additional information.

_description.iso_639_3_eng: Use this field as a pasteboard to add relevant information that does not belong to existing descriptors. This field can be associated to any level, from the observation to the GCU. The field does not hold any indication to the language of the comments.
